Posts.Content: I am writing to find out if anyone out there can give me some advice. I had my annual mammogram recently and was called back for a compression test. The facility also uses CAD (computer aided detection). I was told they saw a "mass", but it could just be a fold in the skin. I also had a sonogram the previous year to take a second look. I have been told I have very fibrous tissue,and they also used the term "dense tissue". I have been told now that they have detetmined there is no concern, that my test is clean. My sister died of metatastic breast cancer at age 37, fifteen years ago. I am 52. I feel umcomfortable with this, and it just seems as though it's all too vague. I called my family doctor and asked them to read the report to me, and that didn't really ease my anxiety either. I asked if maybe I should have another sonogram, or maybe an MRI, but they don't think it's necessary. Should I insist? Thanks so much to anyone who is interested and concerned that replys.
Posts.Title: Second Opinion?

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for your advice...which I am going to take. Knowing how insidious this disease can be, and reading all of the message boards here and on other sites about missed diagnosis, I would be a fool not to. You must be a strong and brave women to stand up for yourself, and I am going to think of you when I talk to my doctor. I pray for your victory for a long healthy life!!!
Posts.Title: Second Opinion?
